column4: Hi, can anyone help me with some graphics driver issues please
join the club :)
lol, spent all day yesterday and got nowhere
whatever you do DO NOT install the driver from the nvidia site.  totally screwed my xserver and had to reinstall the os
ok, already did that, will i need to reinstall ?
well, if you can get gdm and x to start, then you're ahead of where i was
yeah they start but only in low-graphics mode
after i installed the driver from the site, i couldn't get of of command line.  that's why i started over again
think i'm just gonna re-install os anyway - i'm sure in all my tinkering i may have messed something up
you will still be stuck in low res mode though... that's why i'm here
you had any progress at all ?
nope, just watching zamba's progress.  after asking the question for an hour zamba finally got someone to answer
apparently zamba had luck with getting rid of xorg.conf - go figure
yeh i have tried restoring xorg.conf to original ver - no luck
remove it all together ?
yeah
& koopee: will try that now
same
out of curiosity, what brand monitor are you using?
i just found out by looking at the x log that the EDID (the plug & play for the monitor) info is being rejected
yeah, that's what I thought, but 8.10 doesn't seem to populate the xorg.conf file like it used to
try turning your monitor off and on - sometimes this helps
are your hsync  and vsync set correctly?
